popupInfo.description: Buy clothes, stickers, and decorations for your Odyssey! You can spend your regular gold coins or regional purple coins here.
This shiny gray cube is made of large chunks of minerals from the Moon and the raw form of power moons. It can be activiated after completing the main story.
This painting can be used to teleport between the Sand Kingdom and the Wooded or Lake Kingdom.
This painting can be used to teleport between the Sand Kingdom and the Metro Kingdom.
Use this hint art to find a power moon in another kingdom.
This is where your ship is located.
Welcome to Tostarena Town! It's always a fiesta here!
A floating island in the sky, only accessable through a painting.
A splash of cool in the scorching sands.
The perfect place to start your ruins-hopping adventure!
Spirals of sand rises through the ruins, ready to take you to new heights!
Climb this spiral relic to catch a breeze and a better view.
Hold onto your hats (wink wink) as a stone beast takes you for a wild ride!
Where ancient statues strut their stuff in shades. X-ray vision has never been cooler.
It's a trek to get here, but the hidden treasures are worth every step!
Use the painting found in either the Wooded or Lake Kingdom (it differs depending on which you visited first) to teleport here.
As you walk on the peak of the tallest sand dune, feel for the strongest rumble in your controller and ground pound.

name: 31 | Found in the Sand! Good Dog!

popupInfo.description: Let the dog near the town lead you towards a power moon. Once it digs in the ground, you can ground pound the glowing spot to collect this moon.
Buy a power moon from the Crazy Cap store for 100 gold coins.
After completing the main story, speak to the Bonneton near Tostarena Town, then find his friend hanging out on someone's head. Try looking near the Crazy Cap store!
Speak with the Tostarenan standing by the taxi in Tostarena Town. Meet up with him as he visits several kingdoms before finally returning home.
Talk to the toad listening to music in Tostarena Town. Play him anything in your music list that is from a boss fight.
Enter the slots room in Tostarena Town. Pay 10 coins to play, and throw Cappy when the power moon image lights up. You can also win the other prizes like this!
Capture and launch the rocket in Tostarena Town. Your power moon is waiting for you halfway through the obstacle course above the row of three blocks.
Capture and launch the rocket in Tostarena Town. Navigate through the strange neighborhood to collect your moon at the end.

name: 15 | Hang Your Hat on the Fountain

popupInfo.description: Throw Cappy onto the top of the fountain at the center of town.
On the west side of Tostarena Town are three pots. Take the seed in front of the pots and toss it into one of them. Check back on it later for a prize!
Look for a seed in the Tostarena Ruins. It is hidden in an alcove in the wall on the east side. Throw it into one of the pots in Tostarena Town and check back on it later for a prize!

name: 27 | Desert Gardening: Seed on a Cliff

popupInfo.description: Look for a seed hanging out on the side of a cliff. Throw it into one of the pots in Tostarena Town and check back on it later for a prize!

name: 52 | A Rumble from the Sandy Floor

popupInfo.description: Use the warp pipe near Talkatoo. Find the spot in the room that vibrates your controller the most and ground pound!
It's located inside a bell tower on the rear end of town.
In Tostarena town, there is a citizen standing next to a locked door. Approach him while wearing a sombrero and poncho (purchased with purple coins) to be let inside. Now jam out!
Keep an eye out for a glowing bird flying through the desert. Knock into it with Mario or Cappy to get this power moon.
Capture Lakitu at the oasis. Cast your line when you find a shadow, and when your controller vibrates, pull the line up for a cheep cheep (and your next moon)!

name: 32 | Taking Notes: Jump on the Palm

popupInfo.description: Reach the treble clef at the top of a palm tree then collect all the music notes before time runs out.
A group of birds are gathered on a small mound at the oasis. Ground pound it to collect this moon!
There is a statue on a pedastal near the Desert Oasis. Bring Jaxi to the empty pedastal across from it.

name: 37 | You're Quite a Catch, Captain Toad!

popupInfo.description: Capture Lakitu at the oasis. Reel in the largest shadow to reveal Captain Toad (and your next moon)!
Keep an eye out for a cactus that can be captured -- it's hiding a power moon!
Speak with the red koopa standing alone in the desert near the poison swamp to begin the trace-walking challenge.
There's a low-flying bird near the poison swamp carrying a power moon. Hit the bird to grab it!
Drop down into the sinkhole in the Tostarena Ruins. Make your way through the ice cavern there. Once you emerge, you'll find this moon in a chest.
Use a Jaxi to cross the poison swamp and enter the ruins below. Reach the treble clef at the center then collect all the music notes before time runs out.
Use a Jaxi to cross the poison swamp and enter the ruins below. Carefully navigate it to reach the power moon at the end.
Capture the scarecrow to the east of the poison swamp to start this timer challenge.
You will have to capture something to get to this.

name: 11 | On Top of the Stone Archway

popupInfo.description: Use the power line that zips right over the stone archway. De-capture the spark pylon to drop onto the moon below.

name: 20 | Inside a Block is a Hard Place

popupInfo.description: Look for a glowing block in the Tostarena Ruins. You'll have to break it with a bullet bill to collect this moon.

name: 35 | Love in the Heart of the Desert

popupInfo.description: Capture one of the goombas in Tostarena Ruins. Stack goombas into a tower by jumping on other goombas. Once you're tall enough, approach the goombette. She'll swoon and drop a power moon for you.
There is a power moon trapped in a cage in the Tostarena Ruins. Break through with a bullet bill to reach it!
This moon is in a hidden alcove in the walls near the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower.

name: 12 | From a Crate in the Ruins

popupInfo.description: Keep an eye out for a glowing crate! Break it to reveal this power moon.
Enter the 8-bit pipe at the bottom of the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower and keep climbing until you reach the top. This moon will be waiting for you there!
Make your way through the 8-bit mural. Right before you exit the other side, look for this moon to the left.

name: 8 | Hidden Room in the Flowing Sands

popupInfo.description: Look for a little gap between the wall and the sand. There's a hidden room there!
Enter the sinkhole in the Tostarena Ruins and go through the course until you reach the six pillars moving up and down. Wall jump between the last two to reach this moon.
On the north side of the Tostarena Ruins, there is a sphynx. Answer his simple question correctly for a power moon!
On the north side of the Tostarena Ruins, there is a sphynx. Answer all his questions correctly for a reward!
Capture Glydon to reach this moon.
Notice that each corner of the inverted pyramid has a Jaxi statue, except for one. Use the nearby Jaxi stop to call a ride and bring him to the vacant pedestal.
There's a secret passageway in the far wall. It looks like a small gap.

name: 46 | Hidden Room in the Inverted Pyramid

popupInfo.description: On the way to the to of the inverted pyramid, there's a room where you fly a bullet bill past moving pillars. Land on this platform to enter the hidden room on the left.
Reenter the underground temple through the massive sandpit. Stack as many goombas as possible to reach this power moon.

In the underground temple, capture a bullet bill and veer right around a corner to find a path up the side of a stone wall. Continue to the narrow walkway below. The raised platform at the end has a chest holding your power moon.
You can find something moving across the floor on top of the inverted pyramid. Hit it with Cappy to stun it for a few seconds, then ground pound.
One of the Jaxi statues on top of the inverted pyramid will have a glowing tail. Throw Cappy at it to collect this moon.
Reenter Deepest Underground by jumping into the hole with two townsfolk around it. Ground pound the glowing mummy to reveal a hidden moon.
After completing the main story, reenter Deepest Underground by jumping into the hole with two townsfolk around it and ground pound the ring.
There is a glowing spot on the ground near the taxi. Give it a ground pound to collect this moon.
There is a row of cactuses at the very top of the map. Destroy the largest one using Jaxi to collect the hidden power moon.
Find the Tostarenan making a fuss in a stone circle. Theyâ€™ll tell you three of their sheep have gone missing. Find the sheep roaming nearby and herd them into the circle.

name: 55 | Skull Sign in the Invisible Maze

popupInfo.description: Reach the alcove just north of the Moe-Eye Habitat island and enter the Hat Door. In the first room, toss Cappy onto the skull sign and it will pop out a hidden moon.
Reach the alcove just north of the Moe-Eye Habitat island and enter the Hat Door. Capture the Moe-Eye to navigate through the three rooms to collect a power moon.

name: 56 | The Bullet Bill Maze: Break Through!

popupInfo.description: Go through the Hat Door at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches. Use the bullet bills to reach the end of the maze.

name: 57 | The Bullet Bill Maze: Side Path

popupInfo.description: Go through the Hat Door at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches. Follow the thin path to the left before the first set of rotating walls to collect this moon.
The koopa at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches will challenge you to a free-running race. Get first place to win a power moon!
This challenge appears on the top of the building at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches.
A citizen at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches wants Bowser's posters removed from the building's walls. Use Cappy to remove all the posters then speak to him for a reward.
Look for a broken grate on the west side of town. Crawl inside of it to snag a power moon. Wait a minute -- you're not supposed to be here!
Collect 5 moon shards scattered around the poison swamp. One will require you to capture a moe-eye.
Capture a moe-eye at the Moe-Eye Habitat and activate the P-switch on the southwestern side of the poison swamp.
Using Jaxi, reach the treble clef hanging out between two cactuses, then collect all the music notes before time runs out.
To the west of Tostarena Town is a group of rabbits -- one of them carries a power moon. Use Cappy to stun them, then tag them.
Use the moon rock warp pipe near Tostarena Town. Capture a moe-eye to traverse the invisible moving platforms until you reach this power moon on the final platform.
Use the moon rock warp pipe near Tostarena Town. Capture a moe-eye and look to the right side of the pit below. Reach the platform there to collect a key that unlocks a power moon above.

name: 70 | Mighty Leap from the Palm Tree

popupInfo.description: This power moon sits on top of a palm tree at the Desert Oasis. Climb it and do a backflip off of it to reach it!
Speak with the red koopa standing alone in the desert near the poison swamp to begin the trace-walking challenge.
Use Jaxi to run across the poison swamp to the island in the middle.
Use bullet bills to get to the Eastern Pillar. Click on the link for a demonstration.
Enter the moon rock warp pipe at the Tostarena Ruins. Use rocket flowers to navigate the wall to the middle platform, where there's a key to unlock this power moon.

Enter the moon rock warp pipe at the Tostarena Ruins. Use rocket flowers to navigate up the wall to the high platform. Grab more rocket flower to launch yourself towards the platform below and collect the moon.
This moon is floating on some flowing sand near the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower.

name: 80 | Taking Notes: In the Wall Painting

popupInfo.description: Use the 8-bit pipe at the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower. Reach the treble clef in the mural then collect all the music notes before time runs out.

Enter the moon rock warp pipe in the desert to the east of the inverted pyramid. Navigate through the waterway until you reach a section with a high ceiling, then blast up and left to reach the hidden room.
Enter the moon rock warp pipe in the desert to the east of the inverted pyramid. Navigate through the waterway to collect this power moon at the end.
Use the power line that zips right over this pillar. De-capture the spark pylon and drop onto the moon below.

name: 81 | Love at the Edge of the Desert

popupInfo.description: Capture a goomba at the Tostarena Ruins and walk to the goombette at the northern edge of the desert.
The koopa at the Tostarena Northwest Reaches will challenge you to a free-running race. Get first place to win a power moon!

name: 73 | In the Skies Above the Canyon

popupInfo.description: Use the moving platforms from the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower to get to this power moon.
Capture a moe-eye at the Moe-Eye Habitat and take the vertical lift up. Find the beam of light on one of the pillars and ground pound to reveal this power moon.
After completing the main story, talk to Princess Peach at the Tostarena Ruins Round Tower.
Defeat Hariet on top of the inverted pyramid.
After defeating Hariet, a massive sandpit will open up in the ground. Drop down and defeat Knucklotec to collect this multimoon.

3x coins
A small, empty room where you must use your senses to find the secret.
A long hall with invisible moving platforms. Only available after activating the Moon Rock.
A room with a long, curved wall.
A room full of freezing water and stretches of poison. You will find several gushens hanging out here. Only available after activating the Moon Rock.
Three rooms covered in poison, which must be traversed using an invisible path.
A maze with many moving obstacles.
